Description: Sherd from top of East Greek grey ware pottery open-work stand; dull grey fabric with mica and limestone inclusions; worn dark grey slip on projections and on exterior; inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: While it is not impossible that this is from the base, it is more likely that the graffito was cut the right way up and so on the rim of a stand; the unsmoothed nature of what would then be the underside would also be more readily explained. It is plausible that it may be the top element of 1888,0601.637-8 or 1996,0101.1.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (pl. XXXIV, no. 460)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 674, no. 337)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GL.107)
